meanings.definition: A person or thing that thrums.
meanings.sent1: The thrummers of the sewing machine made a rhythmic noise.
meanings.sent2: The band was incomplete without the talented thrummers on the guitar.
meanings.sent3: The thrummers of the old clock seemed to have a conversation with each other.
meanings.sent4: The thrummers of the rain on the roof created a soothing melody.
meanings.sent5: The thrummers of the bee's wings were barely audible but mesmerizing.

meanings.sent1: The talented thrummers played the piano beautifully.
meanings.sent2: The thrummers in the orchestra were skilled musicians.
meanings.sent3: The thrummers in the band always had a smile while performing.
meanings.sent4: The thrummers on the drums set the rhythm for the entire song.
meanings.sent5: The thrummers on the guitar strummed with passion and skill.

meanings.sent1: The thrummers of the engine signaled its smooth operation.
meanings.sent2: The thrummers of the bees filled the garden with a gentle buzz.
meanings.sent3: The thrummers of the fridge seemed to have a secret melody.
meanings.sent4: The thrummers of the wind in the trees created a peaceful atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The thrummers of the distant thunder echoed through the valley.

meanings.sent1: The drummer showcased various thrummers during the performance.
meanings.sent2: The thrummers in the percussion section added depth to the music.
meanings.sent3: The thrummers in the band were always the center of attention.
meanings.sent4: The thrummers of the tambourine added a lively beat to the song.
meanings.sent5: The thrummers of the maracas brought a festive vibe to the music.
